page.title: 02JASON SARGEANT'S DAY
page.content: In the school holidays I go to work with my dad. I get up at 4 a.m.,then I have my breakfast, usually cornflakes. Then about five we go to the depot at Mother's Pride. We load up the bread and cakes, from there we go to Raymonds and get some more. Then we start the round. First we deliver to a shop then to a cafe, they are both in Barnstaple, then we go out to the country and some more shops as well as peoples' houses, we go out as far as Exmoor and Bratton Fleming as well as a few villages. This all takes about seven to eight hours. When we have finished the round we go to my nan's and pick up my mum from work. Then sometimes we go and play Snooker, all our family like playing this so we can all go together. Finally we go home and go to bed ready for the next day.
